title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.001
frontText: Snowflake architecture is made up of single storage and multiple compute engines known as ________________

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.002
frontText: Snowflake architecture is composed of shared storage and multiple compute engines. This architecture is also known as __________________________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.003
frontText: _________ and _________ can be scaled independently because of Snowflake’s hybrid architecture.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.004
frontText: Data in Snowflake is stored on ________________.
backText: Object storage on Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.005
frontText: Snowflake supports which three cloud platforms?
backText: Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.006
frontText: What are the three major layers in Snowflake architecture?
backText: Database Storage, Query Processing, and Cloud Services

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.007
frontText: What are the three cloud‐based object stores that Snowflake supports for storing its data?
backText: AWS S3, Azure Blob Storage, and Google Cloud Storage

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.008
frontText: What is the maximum volume of data that can be stored in a Snowflake‐based implementation?
backText: Virtually unlimited since the data is stored on cloud‐based object storage, which itself is virtually unlimited

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.009
frontText: True/False: Multiple compute engines (virtual warehouses) can be active at the same time.
backText: True: Snowflake allows multiple compute engines.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.010
frontText: True/False: Compute and storage can be scaled independently in Snowflake.
backText: True. Snowflake uses hybrid architecture consisting of shared storage and multiple compute clusters. Either can be scaled independently of the other.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.011
frontText: Which Snowflake layer manages the metadata about how data is stored, information on micro‐partitions, and metadata regarding databases and tables?
backText: The Cloud Services layer stores this metadata as the brain of the operations and has many other functions as well.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.012
frontText: Which Snowflake layer manages the authentication and authorization?
backText: The Cloud Services layer provides this capability in Snowflake.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.013
frontText: _____________________ is the Snowflake layer that is responsible for optimizing and dispatching queries for execution.
backText: The Cloud Services layer is responsible for generating query plans and optimizing and dispatching queries for execution.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.014
frontText: Snowflake uses partitions to store data. What are these partitions called?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.015
frontText: True/False: Micro‐partitions are immutable and cannot be changed once created.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.016
frontText: True/False: Data in micro‐partitions is stored compressed.
backText: True. Snowflake automatically compresses data in a micro‐partition.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.017
frontText: Each micro‐partition contains _____ MB to ____ MB of uncompressed data.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.018
frontText: True/False: For very large tables, there can be millions of micro‐partitions
backText: True. For very large tables, micro‐partitions can run into millions or hundreds of millions.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.019
frontText: Snowflake stores columns in each micro‐partition in a __________ storage format.
backText: Columnar storage format, which allows Snowflake to optimize queries by fetching only the columns referenced in a query.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.020
frontText: True/False: Column values in micro‐partitions can overlap between different micro‐partitions.
backText: True. Unlike typical partitioning, column values in micro‐partitions can overlap.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.021
frontText: True/False: Micro‐partitions are added in the order of how the data was added to a table.
backText: True. Micro‐partitions are created and added to a table in order of the arrival of new data.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.022
frontText: Snowflake maintains metadata for each micro‐partition. The metadata contains the range of ______________.
backText: Column values. Snowflake maintains the metadata and stores the maximum and the minimum value for each column, the count of distinct values, and other information.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.023
frontText: True/False: Data is automatically clustered in Snowflake.
backText: True. Snowflake automatically clusters data in a table. Clustering keys can be defined to re‐cluster the data.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.024
frontText: A virtual warehouse provides resources such as _______, _________ and temporary storage to process queries.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.025
frontText: An X‐Small virtual warehouse consists of ________ node(s), and a Small virtual warehouse consist of _______ node(s).
backText: one, two. Virtual warehouse sizes are in T‐shirt sizes, and the number of nodes doubles with each increase in T‐shirt size.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.026
frontText: True/False: A virtual warehouse can be resized at any time, whether they are running or suspended.
backText: True. A virtual warehouse can be resized at any time. Note that if queries are running on a virtual warehouse and it is resized to a smaller size, the actual resize occurs once the query has finished executing.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.027
frontText: When a virtual warehouse is resized, are existing queries impacted?
backText: No. The new size impacts only new queries.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.028
frontText: True/False: When a virtual warehouse is resized to a smaller size, nodes are removed only when all active queries on those nodes are finished.
backText: True. Active queries are allowed to finish before nodes are deprovisioned.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.029
frontText: Snowflake credits are billed on a per‐ _________ basis.
backText: Second. Credits are billed on a per‐second basis. Note that a minimum of 60‐second billing applies.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.030
frontText: A virtual warehouse is started and stopped within 10 seconds. The customer will be charged for _________ seconds.
backText: 60. A minimum of 60 seconds of billing applies.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.031
frontText: A virtual warehouse is started and stopped after 70 seconds. The customer will be charged for _________ seconds.
backText: 70. After the first minute, Snowflake supports per‐second billing.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.032
frontText: True/False: Running an X‐Small virtual warehouse for 4 hours consumes the same amount of credits as a Small virtual warehouse running for 2 hours.
backText: True. An X‐Small virtual warehouse (1 node) consumes 1 credit per hour, whereas a Small virtual warehouse (2 nodes) consumes 2 credits per hour.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.033
frontText: Which types of virtual warehouses automatically allow adding or removing virtual warehouses in response to changes in concurrency and demand?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.034
frontText: What is the minimum Snowflake edition required for multicluster virtual warehouse capability?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.035
frontText: True/False: A virtual warehouse can be set to auto‐suspend and auto‐resume.
backText: True. A virtual warehouse can be manually or automatically suspended and resumed.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.036
frontText: Which cloud providers are Snowflake cloud partners?
backText: Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.037
frontText: Matillion is a(n) ________ partner of Snowflake.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.038
frontText: Informatica is a(n) ________ partner of Snowflake.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.039
frontText: Power BI is a(n) ________ partner of Snowflake.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.040
frontText: Collibra is a(n) ________ partner of Snowflake.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.041
frontText: Dataiku is a(n) ________ partner of Snowflake.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.042
frontText: Technology Partners are further classified into which categories?
backText: Data Integration, Business Intelligence, Security and Governance, Machine Learning and Data Science, SQL Development and Management, and Native Programming Interfaces

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.043
frontText: True/False: Snowflake has drivers for the Go language.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.044
frontText: True/False: Snowflake provides connectors for Python, Spark, and Kafka.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.045
frontText: What does SnowCD stand for?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.046
frontText: What is SnowCD used for?
backText: SnowCD helps users troubleshoot their network connection to Snowflake.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.047
frontText: What is the command‐line tool for connecting to Snowflake?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.048
frontText: What is Snowsight?
backText: Snowsight is the modern Snowflake web interface, which is now the primary way of interacting with your Snowflake instance.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.049
frontText: What command will load data from a named internal stage into a Snowflake table?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.050
frontText: Which command can be used to unload data from a table into a stage?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.051
frontText: Bulk data can be loaded into Snowflake by using the ____________ command.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.052
frontText: Near‐real‐time or streaming data can be loaded into a Snowflake table by using a ________________________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.053
frontText: The load metadata expires after ____ days.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.054
frontText: What is the purpose of load metadata?
backText: Snowflake stores load metadata to ensure it can track loaded files so that it doesn’t reprocess already loaded files.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.055
frontText: True/False: Snowpipe is a serverless service.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.056
frontText: True/False: The billing for Snowpipe is included with virtual warehouse billing.
backText: False. Snowpipe is serverless and is billed separately.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.057
frontText: Snowflake supports which semi‐structured file formats?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.058
frontText: Snowflake supports which structured file formats?
backText: Delimited text files such as CSV and TSV, or files separated by another single‐byte delimiter

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.059
frontText: True/False: Data loaded in an internal stage is automatically compressed using gzip compression.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.060
frontText: True/False: Data loaded in an internal stage is automatically encrypted.
backText: True. Data in a Snowflake internal stage is automatically encrypted using 256‐bit encryption.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.061
frontText: Snowflake stages can be divided into which two types?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.062
frontText: True/False: Data in an internal stage contributes to overall storage costs.
backText: True. Snowflake manages internal stages, and any data stored in an internal stage contributes to storage costs.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.063
frontText: An external stage points to a location outside of ____________.
backText: Snowflake. An external stage refers to a storage location in a cloud platform such as an AWS S3 bucket.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.064
frontText: Snowflake internal stages can be further classified into which three types?
backText: Table stages, user stages, and named internal stages

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.065
frontText: A user stage is automatically created for every _______.
backText: User. Similarly, a table stage is created for each table automatically.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.066
frontText: What actions cannot be performed on a user stage or a table stage?
backText: User stages and Table stages cannot be altered or dropped, and they do not allow you to set file format options.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.067
frontText: True/False: A user can access another user’s user stage.
backText: False. A user stage is unique to that user and is not accessible to another user.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.068
frontText: True/False: A user stage can be used to load multiple tables, whereas a table stage can only load a single table.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.069
frontText: True/False: A named internal stage can be created, altered, and dropped.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.070
frontText: What command can be used to load data from an on‐premises system to an internal stage?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.071
frontText: What command can be used to download data from an internal stage to an on‐premises system?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.072
frontText: Data can be loaded using Snowflake Web UI; however, it is intended to load only a limited number of small‐sized files up to ____ MB.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.073
frontText: True/False: Snowflake allows you to apply basic transformations such as changing the column order, omitting columns, or type casting while using the COPY command.
backText: True. The COPY command supports these basic transformations.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.074
frontText: True/False: The COPY command can load or unload data using a SELECT query.
backText: True. You can use a SELECT query to unload data from a table. Also, you can use SELECT to read data from a stage object and then load it into a table.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.075
frontText: True/False: An external table can be queried and joined with other tables like any standard Snowflake table.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.076
frontText: Under what scenarios is an external table an appropriate choice?
backText: When data is in existing data lakes, it is infrequently accessed, or only a subset of data is to be queried.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.077
frontText: An external table must be created against an external __________ pointing to a cloud object storage location.
backText: Stage. An external table must point to an external stage.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.078
frontText: True/False: The VARIANT data type can store any type of data.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.079
frontText: The VARIANT data type can store up to ____ MB of uncompressed data per row.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.080
frontText: The scaling up and down of Snowpipe is managed by ___________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.081
frontText: What are the two methods that trigger a Snowpipe?
backText: Cloud platform notifications or a REST API call

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.082
frontText: For optimal load performance, the recommended file size for a single file is ____________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.083
frontText: True/False: Splitting the file into multiple files for parallel and optimized loading of files is recommended when loading large files.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.084
frontText: True/False: Having all the files in a single folder will improve load performance.
backText: False: Files should be organized in a folder structure to ensure efficient execution of the list files operation during COPY.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.085
frontText: ____________ are used to execute a stored procedure or a SQL statement on schedule.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.086
frontText: True/False: Multiple tasks can be connected to perform multiple actions.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.087
frontText: A task can have a maximum of ____ child tasks, and a complete tree of tasks is limited to a maximum of _____ total tasks.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.088
frontText: Tasks can use a virtual warehouse or can use ___________ compute.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.089
frontText: True/False: Streams can be used to track data changes made to a table data, including inserts, updates, and deletes.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.090
frontText: For change data capture in Snowflake, _________ can be used.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.091
frontText: Streams can be queried just like ________; however, they don’t contain data but can be thought of as bookmarks that encapsulate changed data.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.092
frontText: How many days of Time Travel are allowed in Snowflake’s standard edition?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.093
frontText: What is the minimum Snowflake edition that allows up to 90 days of Time Travel?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.094
frontText: Fail‐safe keeps data for an additional ______ days beyond the Time Travel duration.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.095
frontText: True/False: Only Snowflake support can recover data from the Fail‐Safe storage.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.096
frontText: True/False: Time Travel can be configured as 0 for specific tables if desired.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.097
frontText: True/False: Using Time Travel, users can see data as it existed before or on a specific time or before a query was run.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.098
frontText: True/False: Snowflake allows recovering dropped tables, schemas, and databases using the UNDROP command.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.099
frontText: Transient and temporary tables can have only up to _____ day(s) of Time Travel and _____ day(s) Fail‐Safe period.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.100
frontText: True/False: Temporary tables exist only for the duration of the session in which they were created.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.101
frontText: True/False: Transient tables are available across sessions and are not dropped when the session ends.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.102
frontText: True/False: A cloned object does not contribute to the overall storage until DML operations are performed on the source or target.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.103
frontText: Cloning or zero‐copy cloning is a _______ operation.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.104
frontText: Tables, _________ and even _________ can be cloned.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.105
frontText: Cloning can be combined with ___________ to produce clones of data as it existed at a specific point in time.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.106
frontText: What are the three Snowflake offerings for data sharing?
backText: Direct Sharing, Data Exchange, and Snowflake Data Marketplace

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.107
frontText: Secure data sharing does not copy data, but it is a ________ operation.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.108
frontText: Which objects can be shared through secure data sharing?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.109
frontText: A share can only be created by the ACCOUNTADMIN role or a role with____________ privileges.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.110
frontText: To share data from multiple tables existing in different databases, Snowflake recommends creating a _____________ to share the data.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.111
frontText: Data can be shared with a non‐Snowflake user by creating a ____________ account.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.112
frontText: Compute costs for a reader account are billed to the _______________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.113
frontText: When sharing data with another Snowflake account, the compute costs are billed to the _____________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.114
frontText: True/False: Snowflake Data Marketplace allows users to search for and access third‐party datasets made public by various organizations.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.115
frontText: Snowflake Data Marketplace is available to all Snowflake accounts except ______________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.116
frontText: True/False: Data Exchange is your own private data sharing hub that can be used to share data among a selected group of invite‐only members.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.117
frontText: When a virtual warehouse is scaled up, charging for the new size does not begin until all the new nodes in the larger virtual warehouse have been ____________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.118
frontText: When a virtual warehouse is scaled up, are existing queries impacted?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.119
frontText: Scaling up a virtual warehouse is in response to ________________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.120
frontText: Scaling out a virtual warehouse is in response to ________________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.121
frontText: When a virtual warehouse is scaled down, nodes are removed only when there is no __________ query.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.122
frontText: What are the two scaling modes supported by multicluster virtual warehouses?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.123
frontText: What are the two scaling policies supported by multicluster virtual warehouses when in autoscale mode?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.124
frontText: Which scaling policy ensures maximum performance?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.125
frontText: Which scaling policy tries to conserve credits over performance?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.126
frontText: True/False: A multicluster virtual warehouse cluster dynamically starts or stops virtual warehouses in autoscale mode depending on the query demand.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.127
frontText: What are the 3 types of caches used in query processing in Snowflake?
backText: Metadata cache, virtual warehouse or local disk cache, and query result cache

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.128
frontText: What type of queries can be answered directly from the metadata cache and do not require an active virtual warehouse?
backText: Those queries that perform only a COUNT, MAX, or a MIN operation, since the metadata cache can fulfill that information

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.129
frontText: True/False: If a query has been executed before and the underlying data hasn’t changed, results for a semantically similar query can be fulfilled from the query result cache.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.130
frontText: The query result cache is retained for a maximum of ____ days.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.131
frontText: If the query result cache is not reused within ___ hours of its last use, the result cache is purged.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.132
frontText: The virtual warehouse cache is local to each _____________ and cannot be shared.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.133
frontText: When a virtual warehouse is suspended, the warehouse cache is _________

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.134
frontText: True/False: Snowflake can optimize query execution by eliminating micro‐partitions that do not contain values specified by a filter predicate.
backText: True. This is also known as partition pruning.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.135
frontText: Partition pruning can be improved by defining appropriate __________ keys.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.136
frontText: What is the service name responsible for redistributing data according to the clustering key?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.137
frontText: True/False: A materialized view is a type of view that stores precomputed data based on a SELECT query.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.138
frontText: True/False: The data in a materialized view updates automatically if the data in the base table changes.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.139
frontText: True/False: A materialized view can be used to improve query performance.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.140
frontText: All data at rest in Snowflake is encrypted using what type of encryption?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.141
frontText: Snowflake manages the encryption keys, ________ the key after 30 days, and rekeys the encrypted data after ___________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.142
frontText: Tri‐Secure Secure allows customers to bring their own ____ and requires a minimum of the Business Critical edition.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.143
frontText: True/False: MFA is enabled by default for all Snowflake accounts.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.144
frontText: True/False: If required, MFA can be disabled for a user by an administrator.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.145
frontText: In Snowflake, MFA is supported by which connectors and client tools?
backText: SnowSQL, Snowflake web interface, ODBC, JDBC drivers, and Python connectors

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.146
frontText: _____________ authentication in Snowflake consists of private keys and public keys and is an alternate to the basic authentication.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.147
frontText: True/False: Snowflake supports federated authentication, allowing for single sign‐on (SSO) through an external identity provider (IdP) that supports SAML 2.0.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.148
frontText: True/False: Snowflake supports SCIM 2.0 and can connect to Okta and Azure AD.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.149
frontText: What does RBAC stand for?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.150
frontText: What does DAC stand for?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.151
frontText: What are securable objects in Snowflake?
backText: Objects to which a set of privileges can be granted

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.152
frontText: What are the built‐in Snowflake roles?
backText: PUBLIC, SYSADMIN, USERADMIN, SECURITYADMIN, and ACCOUNTADMIN

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.153
frontText: What are the two methods for column‐level security in Snowflake?
backText: Dynamic data masking and external tokenization

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.154
frontText: What policies enable column‐level security in Snowflake?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.155
frontText: Row access policies can be used to provide ______________ security.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.156
frontText: Which view types ensure that the underlying data is not visible to the user?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.157
frontText: Network policies can be used to allow or deny access to specific _____________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.158
frontText: Private connectivity to Snowflake requires a minimum of ______________ edition.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.159
frontText: Snowflake encrypts all communication end to end using __________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.160
frontText: ___________ help manage costs and avoid unexpected credit usage by virtual warehouses.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.161
frontText: True/False: Resource monitors can monitor a single virtual warehouse, multiple virtual warehouses, or the complete Snowflake account.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.162
frontText: True/False: Resource monitors can suspend user‐managed virtual warehouses only. They cannot impact serverless features.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.163
frontText: The ACCOUNT_USAGE schema has _____ days of data retention and _______ latency.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.164
frontText: The INFOMRATION_SCHEMA schema has up to 6 ______ of data retention and _______ latency.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.165
frontText: Snowflake releases software updates every _________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.166
frontText: Snowflake deploys two planned or scheduled releases every __________

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.167
frontText: Snowflake deploys a behavior change release once per __________

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.168
frontText: Snowflake releases are deployed for _________________ first.
backText: Enterprise and above accounts opted‐in for early access

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.169
frontText: True/False: All Snowflake accounts support Time Travel.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.170
frontText: Private connectivity to Snowflake is supported by ________ edition and above.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.171
frontText: Where does the code for an external user‐defined function execute?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.172
frontText: Snowflake UDFs can be written in which languages?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.173
frontText: A Scalar UDF returns _____ row(s) and one column for each input row.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.174
frontText: A table UDF can return how many rows for each input row?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.175
frontText: True/False: Stored procedures support if‐else logic, looping, and variables.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.176
frontText: A stored procedure can be configured to execute under the privileges of the caller or the privileges of the ___________ .

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.177
frontText: True/False: A stored procedure running under the owner's privilege can access objects and perform actions that the caller may not have the privilege to do.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.178
frontText: True/False: A UDF must return a result; however, a stored procedure is not required to return a result.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.179
frontText: True/False: Secure UDFs can hide the implementation code from the user and ensure that access to underlying data is not allowed.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.180
frontText: True/False: A stored procedure can return a single value or tabular data; however, it is not required that a stored procedure must return a value.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.181
frontText: True/False: The purpose of a UDF is to process input, perform calculations, and return a value, whereas the purpose of a stored procedure is to execute one or more SQL statements.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.182
frontText: Snowpark allows developers to use which languages?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.183
frontText: True/False: Snowpark converts programming constructs to SQL and pushes them down to Snowflake for execution.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.184
frontText: True/False: Snowflake's Snowpark library provides APIs for querying and processing data using programming languages other than SQL.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.185
frontText: _______________ adds procedural logic to SQL, such as if‐else, looping, cursors, and exception handling.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.186
frontText: True/False: Snowflake charges for data replication, including the data transfer, and computes costs for replication.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.187
frontText: True/False: The storage cost of replicated data is charged separately.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.188
frontText: To set up ____________, the source database is designated as a primary database.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.189
frontText: To share data with accounts in other regions or other cloud providers, you must _________ data first.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.190
frontText: In a query profile, Partitions Total and Partitions Scanned indicate what?
backText: Partitions Total shows the total number of partitions in a table, and the Partitions Scanned shows the number of partitions read during query execution.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.191
frontText: What does Bytes Spilled To Local Storage mean?
backText: Snowflake can store interim results in virtual warehouse storage during query execution if the memory is insufficient to hold the results. The volume of data stored in virtual warehouse storage is shown under Bytes Spilled To Local Storage.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.192
frontText: A smaller average clustering depth indicates that a table is ________________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.193
frontText: True/False: Clustering depth measures the average depth of the overlapping micro‐partitions for givens columns.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.194
frontText: Snowflake provides the concept of ______________ that enable a business entity to link together all accounts owned by that entity.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.195
frontText: A user with the ORGADMIN role can create new _________.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.196
frontText: True/False: DELETE privileges are required for a user to run an INSERT OVERWRITE statement successfully.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.197
frontText: What Snowflake feature can be used to generate unique numbers across sessions and statements?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.198
frontText: True/False: The directory table acts as a catalog of the stage object and provides a list of files in the stage.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.199
frontText: What type of URL provides temporary access to a staged unstructured file?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.200
frontText: A Scoped URL expires after _______ hours.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.201
frontText: A file URL to an unstructured file provides ___________ access.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.202
frontText: What type of URL allows users access to the staged unstructured file without requiring authorization?

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.203
frontText: By default, Snowflake unloads data to ___________ file(s).

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.204
frontText: In Snowflake, the default maximum size for an exported file is ________ MB.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.205
frontText: The maximum size of an exported file can be increased up to a maximum of ______ GB.

title: fc824442.SnoProCoCeSG.206
frontText: Snowflake _____________ the value of floating‐point numbers when exporting data to CSV or JSON files.
